meanings.definition: Lacking good sense or judgment; foolish.
meanings.sent1: The sapheaded decision to jump off the roof resulted in a broken leg.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed after making a sapheaded mistake in front of her classmates.
meanings.sent3: His sapheaded attempt to cook dinner without any experience ended in a burnt kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The sapheaded idea of wearing shorts in the snow quickly proved to be a bad choice.
meanings.sent5: The sapheaded squirrel kept trying to climb the slippery pole, only to fall each time.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to that sapheaded, he always gives bad advice.
meanings.sent2: The village was full of sapheads who believed every rumor they heard.
meanings.sent3: The group of sapheads thought it would be funny to prank their teacher.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a sapheaded for forgetting her keys inside the locked car.
meanings.sent5: The old man chuckled at the antics of the young sapheaded playing in the park.
